text: The 2021 CONCACAF Gold Cup is the 16th event of the CONCACAF Gold Cup. It is an international men's football championship organized by North America, Central American, and the Caribbean's football ruling body CONCACAF. The tournament was originally set to be held from 2 through 25 July 2021, but was later rescheduled for 10 July through 1 August because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Mexico are the defending champions. For the first time, the video assistant referee (VAR) system is used at the tournament. ==References== Category:July 2021 events Category:2021 in association football
title: 2021 CONCACAF Gold Cup
